titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Long Island Insurance Company subscription book and architectural drawing 1977.013
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T11:48-0500

did.unittitle: Long Island Insurance Company subscription book and architectural drawing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a subscription book to the capital stock of the Long Island Insurance Company, dated 1833, and an architectural drawing of the Company's building by Richard Laurence, dated 1834.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of Walter Nichols, date unknown.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Long Island Insurance Company subscription book and architectural drawing, 1977.013, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Long Island Insurance Company was organized in Brooklyn in 1833.
